title: Police reports lodged against driver who insulted JPJ officer - Nation

persons.name: datuk wan ahmad uzir wan sulaiman

text:
PETALING JAYA: Two police reports have been lodged against a 25-year-old driver after a screenshot of him spewing obscenities at a Road Transport Department (JPJ) officer went viral on social media. 
The Perodua MyVi driver insulted the JPJ officer after failing to bribe his way out of a summons.
The driver was apparently issued a summons by the JPJ officer after he allegedly abused the emergency lane at KM318 of the North-South Expressway in Perak at around 4.25pm on Jan 27.
Not wanting to be hauled to court for the offence, the driver allegedly offered to pay off the officer, who rejected the attempted bribe.
The driver finally accepted the notice and took off.
At about 10.30pm, the officer who was at the PLUS office in Tapah, Perak, received a screenshot of the driver's WeChat message which was shared to him in a WhatsApp group chat.
The driver apparently published photos of their encounter earlier that day, accompanied with vulgarities directed at the officer.
In the comment section, the driver claimed that he and his passenger had used the emergency lane because they were rushing back for the Chinese New Year reunion dinner.
Peninsula JPJ Officers Union president Hamzah Masri confirmed the incident. 
The JPJ officer lodged the first report in Perak on Jan 28, while the union filed the other report in Putrajaya on Tuesday.
Meanwhile, JPJ deputy director-general (management) Datuk Wan Ahmad Uzir Wan Sulaiman urged JPJ officers to file a report with the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) if they were offered bribes by traffic offenders.
